reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the fourth year we stayed with Seawatch - we have no reason to leave! The prices are cheap for what you get. It's in a quiet spot near North Myrtle, very easy to drive to (and park at) with none of the hustle and bustle of Southern Myrtle Beach. Every employee greeted us and wanted to see if there was anything else they could do to make our stay more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Always Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have plenty of space and all let you look out over the ocean and the various pools and spas. We love going to the Tiki Hut for our once a year pina colada and margarita and the breakfast in the morning (included with the room) is the best we've ever had at a hotel. The made to order waffles and omelets along with every other breakfast food has always been phenomenal. And we love sitting by the window to look at the water and sunrise while we eat breakfast.
reviews.title: We will stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: For the first time this year we ended up checking out of Seawatch early to go stay at another hotel booked by my husband's company for their outing. I thought, "A hotel on the beach is a hotel on the beach right?" I could not have been more wrong! We should have run back to Seawatch and finished our vacation there. While the other hotel had the same amenities - the atmosphere and service was NOT the same.
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: II cannot stay anywhere else in Myrtle Beach now - so I'm telling you to run over to Seawatch. For the value it absolutely cannot be beat!
reviews.title: A Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 5-night stay at the Sea Watch (9/7-9/12). This was our first time and we loved it. We've been vacationing in Myrtle Beach almost every year for the past 25 years, and never stayed at the same place twice. Other resorts were pretty good, but there was always some little thing we didn't like. There was nothing about the Sea Watch we didn't like.
reviews.title: Best MB vacation spot yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time in Myrtle Beach and I agonized for days over staying at the Sea Watch Resort or somewhere in downtown Myrtle Beach. Finally the good reviews here won me over and we just spent some of our happiest and most relaxing vacation days at the Sea Watch!
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The property is huge with 2 high-rise towers. The layout of the building is smart and ensures that the majority of the rooms are direct ocean front with fewer rooms that are ocean view. I would recommend paying a little more for the ocean front rooms - they are worth it.
reviews.title: Lived up to good reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Going during off-season and in mid-week, we got good rates and the place was not crowded at all. The breakfast buffet included with our package was awesome, the view was fantastic, the grounds are very well kept up, the housekeeping service was efficient, the rooms are pleasantly decorated, the pools and hot tubs (so many of them) are cleaned daily and finally the beach is pristine. The location was pretty convenient as well.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, family oriented, good rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009
reviews.text: Just for kicks, we drove to downtown Myrtle Beach one afternoon to check out the other hotels there that we had considered. The whole area just had a different feel - T-shirt shops, souvenir stores, arcades, Ripley's attractions and so forth. The hotels were much closer together and felt more crowded. Also the new Board Walk construction just began so there were some safety construction fencing along parts of the beach. After seeing this, we felt that the Sea Watch was definitely the right accommodation for us and look forward to returning!
reviews.title: Easy Choice; for Best Hotel Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, mother, daughter (10 month) and I booked a weekend in Myrtle Beach at Sea Watch based on the good reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We were located in room 817 in the South Tower and had a wonderful view of the ocean and pool area from the balcony. The rooms were not fancy but they were comfortable and clean. It was super just to walk right out to the beach and our daughter really enjoyed the Lazy River pool at the resort. Within a 5 minute drive there is a Walmart and coffee and deli shops so it is easy to stock up on supplies and/or go out for food. Good value for the money. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Not exotic, but will do !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: sea watch resort was an outstanding choice....friendly ,knowledgeable staff,large clean accommedations at a great price,,,very good food,great selection ..clean pools,wonderful beach and good scenery
reviews.title: great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I recently stayed at Sea Watch with two of my sisters, my two daughters and one of their boyfriends, and my granddaughter. We were all extremely pleased with our accomodations and with the service, and will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kathy Thielbar and Family
reviews.title: Great place to watch the sea at Sea Watch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My sister-in-law and her husband stayed here a year ago and raved about its location. I then read the reviews for this hotel on Trip Advisor and it had a strong rating (3rd best of 200+ on Myrtle Beach). My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary and concur that it is a great place to watch the sea at Sea Watch. Facing the ocean, there is only one other hotel heading east for the next mile or two which gives you the best of both worlds: plenty of entertainment along Rte 17 and quiet serene beach for miles away from the crowded hotel scene further west on Myrtle Beach. The service is also impeccable. Tonya made us feel right at home immediately with her infectious humor. Traveling at the end of August is another bonus as the local kids are in school and the pool and beach area were not crowded.
reviews.title: Decent For the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The things we were impressed with the most; The Dj party on tuesdays and thursdays. Filled with games for our children, hula hoops, swim races, and fun dancing music. Definitly the kids favorite part. The Tiki bar was fun as well, and virgin drinks for our boys. A lil pricey but understandable.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a lovely resort. We were very impressed with the accommodations, location and all amenities. We booked an oceanfront 3 bdrm/2 ba condo, but was DELIGHTED that we were given an oceanfront 3 bdrm/3 ba condo instead. Our condo comfortably accomodated 10 people (including 5 kids all under the age of 5). There was plenty of living space that allowed them to run and play; the double balconies were a definite plus!! We plan to stay at Sea Watch for all future trips to Myrtle Beach, SC.
reviews.title: Super First Stay!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: K. Washington, Columbia, SC
reviews.title: Great place for families to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and clean. The breakfast buffet is excellent. The hotel has easy beach access and is close to all the great attractions at Myrtle Beach. This is a wonderful place to stay.
reviews.title: Our repeat stay was better than ever!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at Sea Watch. We have stayed here before with our children and had a great experience then..and an even greater experience this time! We have stayed at other resorts in Myrtle Beach, but there are some things that the Sea Watch offers that we haven't found anywhere else. First, there is the convenient parking. The parking garage was right under the building we stayed in. We always have had access to luggage carts and a minimal wait for the elevators. This is important especially when traveling with children. Also, we love the easy access to the beach. Some resorts don't have the easiest access in the world. The tiki bar is awesome! Again, we didn't have to go out of our way to find it. It was right on our way down to the beach. There was a DJ there on the Saturday since it was Labor Day week-end. The DJ was great. The pools are nice and clean however one of them was extremely cold! And have I mentioned the breakfast?? This is the main reason my husband wanted to come back here! The breakfast is out of this world!! The omelet station and waffle station are AWESOME! I had mine made with egg whites and the cooks made them however we wanted!! We had our breakfast oceanside every morning!! The breakfast was included with our room, and I can tell you that we don't know of any other resorts who offer this caliber of breakfast! The exercise room is great also. High quality commercial treadmills, bike and elipitical. GREAT! Housekeeping was great, too!!! You can't beat the little things that make this resort so spectacular. It does need updating, but one can certainly overlook that when you consider the price and all of the personal details that make this resort so special. We will be back!!
reviews.title: Our family loves Sea Watch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family just returned from our yearly family vacation in Myrtle Beach. This was our fifth year of staying at Sea Watch and we love it. Our family vacation includes our two daughters and their husbands. We all had a great time. The breakfast buffet was delicious. We love the location of Sea Watch and all the amenities which include several pools, hot tubs & two lazy rivers. We also had friends that came with us this year and they enjoyed Sea Watch also. The staff at Sea Watch is always very kind and very helpful. Prior to finding Sea Watch we stayed at several other places in Myrtle Beach and Sea Watch is the BEST!
reviews.title: just like home
